title: Appointment of 1,000 Officers belonging to the Sri Lanka Education Administrative Service, the Sri Lanka Teacher Educators' Service and the Sri Lanka Principals' Service to the Post of Commissioned Officer of the National Cadet Corps
decision_details: - The National Cadet Corps has been established under the Ministry of Defence as a supplementary force under Part V of the Mobilization and Supplementary Forces Act No. 40 of 1985. Officers in the Ministry of Education and school students are recruited respectively as officers and cadets of the said Corps. In order to further promote the cadet activities in the education sector, it has been intended to conduct a basic training course to recruit officers belonging to the Sri Lanka Education Administrative Service, Sri Lanka Teacher Educators' Service and the Sri Lanka Principals' Service to the  National Cadet Corps and it has been planned to recruit 1,000 officers in Grade I,II and III of the said services and appoint them as Commissioned Officers after a basic training. Accordingly, the joint proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Defence and the Minister of Education to formally select 1,000 qualified officers belonging to Sri Lanka Education Administrative Service, Sri Lanka Teacher Educators' Service and the Sri Lanka Principals' Service and appoint them to the Post of Commissioned Officer after providing them with a basic training under 03 batches, was approved by the Cabinet.
